intro: Lilaeopsis novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand lily, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streams. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
